SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui

Class GUILauncher

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.MyShelfieApplication
it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.GUILauncher
public class GUILauncher extends MyShelfieApplication

This class is used to launch and interact with the Graphical Interface of the Application

The GameEngine class represents the core engine of a game. It manages the game logic and facilitates communication between different components of the game. This class handles various operations such as player management, game state tracking, and game flow control. It provides methods to start the game, handle player actions, and manage the overall gameplay. The GameEngine class serves as the central component that drives the execution of the game and ensures its smooth functioning.

Author:
Tommaso Trabacchin, Melanie Tonarelli, Emanuele Valsecchi, Adem Shehi

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init() throws Exception
      The application initialization method, this method is called immediately after the Application class is loaded and constructed.
      An application may override this method to perform initialization prior to the actual starting of the application.

      The implementation of this method provided by the Application class does nothing.

      NOTE: This method is not called on the JavaFX Application Thread. An application must not construct a Scene or a Stage in this method. An application may construct other JavaFX objects in this method.

      Overrides:
      init in class javafx.application.Application
      Throws:
      Exception - if something goes wrong

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws Exception
      The main entry point for all JavaFX applications. The start method is called after the init method has returned, and after the system is ready for the application to begin running.

      NOTE: This method is called on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      stage - the primary stage for this application, onto which the application scene can be set. Applications may create other stages, if needed, but they will not be primary stages.
      Throws:
      Exception - if something goes wrong

    • getOpponentUpdates

      private Map<String,TileSubject[][]> getOpponentUpdates()
      Retrieves the updates of opponents' bookshelves.
      Returns:
      A map containing the updates of opponents' bookshelves. The keys represent the nicknames of the opponents, and the values are two-dimensional arrays of TileSubject objects representing their bookshelves.

    • getThisPlayerUpdates

      @Nullable private Map.Entry<String,TileSubject[][]> getThisPlayerUpdates()
      Returns:
      null if the bookshelf of the player using the app is not retrieved from the server

    • handleFirstPlayerSeatAssignment

      public void handleFirstPlayerSeatAssignment()
      Handles the assignment of the first player seat. If the seat has not been assigned yet, it adds the first player seat operation.
      See Also:
      • MainInterfaceController.addFirstPlayerSeatOperation(String)

    • handleAssignedCommonGoals

      public void handleAssignedCommonGoals()
      Handles the assignment of the common goals. It calls the respective methods to handle the assignment of common goal 1 and common goal 2.
      See Also:
      • handleAssignedCommonGoal1()
      • handleAssignedCommonGoal2()

    • handleAssignedCommonGoal1

      private void handleAssignedCommonGoal1()
      Handles the assignment of common goal 1. If the available score of common goal 1 is not equal to the displayed common goal score at index 0, it retrieves the player who achieved the common goal and calls the assignScoringToken1 operation in the main interface controller.
      See Also:
      • MainInterfaceController.assignScoringToken1(String)

    • handleAssignedCommonGoal2

      private void handleAssignedCommonGoal2()
      Handles the assignment of common goal 2. If the available score of common goal 2 is not equal to the displayed common goal score at index 1, it retrieves the player who achieved the common goal and calls the assignScoringToken2 operation in the main interface controller.
      See Also:
      • MainInterfaceController.assignScoringToken2(String)

    • getPlayerAchievedCommonGoal

      private Optional<String> getPlayerAchievedCommonGoal(int commonGoalNumber)
      Retrieves the player who achieved the specified common goal.
      Parameters:
      commonGoalNumber - The common goal number (1 or 2).
      Returns:
      The nickname of the player who achieved the common goal, or empty if no player achieved it.

    • handleAssignedEndToken

      public void handleAssignedEndToken()
      Handles the assignment of the end game token. If the end game token has not been assigned yet, it retrieves the player who achieved the end game condition and calls the assignEndGameToken operation in the main interface controller.
      See Also:
      • MainInterfaceController.assignEndGameToken(String)

    • getPlayerAchievedEndGame

      @NotNull private Optional<String> getPlayerAchievedEndGame()
      Retrieves the player who achieved the end game condition.
      Returns:
      The nickname of the player who achieved the end game condition, or empty if no player achieved it.

    • showWinningPageOperation

      public void showWinningPageOperation()
      Shows the winning page in the main interface with the winner player, players' point map, and whether the current player is winning.

    • isThisPlayerWinning

      public boolean isThisPlayerWinning()
      Checks if the current player is winning.
      Returns:
      true if the current player is winning, false otherwise.

    • isThisPlayer

      public boolean isThisPlayer(String playerNick)
      Checks if the given player nickname is the current player.
      Parameters:
      playerNick - The nickname of the player to check.
      Returns:
      true if the given player nickname is the current player, false otherwise.

    • getPlayersPointMap

      @NotNull @Contract(pure=true) private Map<String,Integer> getPlayersPointMap()
      Retrieves the players' point map containing each player's nickname and their total points.
      Returns:
      The map of players' nicknames and their corresponding total points.
